-   `EADDRINUSE` (Address already in use): An attempt to bind a server ([`net`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/net.html), [`http`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/http.html), or [`https`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/https.html)) to a local address failed due to another server on the local system already occupying that address.
    
-   `ECONNREFUSED` (Connection refused): No connection could be made because the target machine actively refused it. This usually results from trying to connect to a service that is inactive on the foreign host.
    
-   `ECONNRESET` (Connection reset by peer): A connection was forcibly closed by a peer. This normally results from a loss of the connection on the remote socket due to a timeout or reboot. Commonly encountered via the [`http`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/http.html) and [`net`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/net.html) modules.
    
-   `EEXIST` (File exists): An existing file was the target of an operation that required that the target not exist.
    
-   `EISDIR` (Is a directory): An operation expected a file, but the given pathname was a directory.
    
-   `EMFILE` (Too many open files in system): Maximum number of [file descriptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_descriptor) allowable on the system has been reached, and requests for another descriptor cannot be fulfilled until at least one has been closed. This is encountered when opening many files at once in parallel, especially on systems (in particular, macOS) where there is a low file descriptor limit for processes. To remedy a low limit, run `ulimit -n 2048` in the same shell that will run the Node.js process.
    
-   `ENOENT` (No such file or directory): Commonly raised by [`fs`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/fs.html) operations to indicate that a component of the specified pathname does not exist. No entity (file or directory) could be found by the given path.
    
-   `ENOTDIR` (Not a directory): A component of the given pathname existed, but was not a directory as expected. Commonly raised by [`fs.readdir`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fsreaddirpath-options-callback).
    
-   `ENOTEMPTY` (Directory not empty): A directory with entries was the target of an operation that requires an empty directory, usually [`fs.unlink`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fsunlinkpath-callback).
    
-   `ENOTFOUND` (DNS lookup failed): Indicates a DNS failure of either `EAI_NODATA` or `EAI_NONAME`. This is not a standard POSIX error.
    
-   `EPERM` (Operation not permitted): An attempt was made to perform an operation that requires elevated privileges.
    
-   `EPIPE` (Broken pipe): A write on a pipe, socket, or FIFO for which there is no process to read the data. Commonly encountered at the [`net`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/net.html) and [`http`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/http.html) layers, indicative that the remote side of the stream being written to has been closed.
    
-   `ETIMEDOUT` (Operation timed out): A connect or send request failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time. Usually encountered by [`http`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/http.html) or [`net`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/net.html). Often a sign that a `socket.end()` was not properly called.
    

### Class: `TypeError`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_class-typeerror)

-   Extends [<errors.Error>](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_class-error)

Indicates that a provided argument is not an allowable type. For example, passing a function to a parameter which expects a string would be a `TypeError`.

```
require('url').parse(() => { });
```

Node.js will generate and throw `TypeError` instances _immediately_ as a form of argument validation.

### Exceptions vs. errors[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_exceptions-vs-errors)

A JavaScript exception is a value that is thrown as a result of an invalid operation or as the target of a `throw` statement. While it is not required that these values are instances of `Error` or classes which inherit from `Error`, all exceptions thrown by Node.js or the JavaScript runtime _will_ be instances of `Error`.

Some exceptions are _unrecoverable_ at the JavaScript layer. Such exceptions will _always_ cause the Node.js process to crash. Examples include `assert()` checks or `abort()` calls in the C++ layer.

### OpenSSL errors[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_openssl-errors)

Errors originating in `crypto` or `tls` are of class `Error`, and in addition to the standard `.code` and `.message` properties, may have some additional OpenSSL-specific properties.

#### `error.opensslErrorStack`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_erroropensslerrorstack)

An array of errors that can give context to where in the OpenSSL library an error originates from.

#### `error.function`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_errorfunction)

The OpenSSL function the error originates in.

#### `error.library`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_errorlibrary)

The OpenSSL library the error originates in.

#### `error.reason`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_errorreason)

A human-readable string describing the reason for the error.

### Node.js error codes[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_nodejs-error-codes)

#### `ABORT_ERR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_abort_err)

Added in: v15.0.0

Used when an operation has been aborted (typically using an `AbortController`).

APIs _not_ using `AbortSignal`s typically do not raise an error with this code.

This code does not use the regular `ERR_*` convention Node.js errors use in order to be compatible with the web platform's `AbortError`.

#### `ERR_AMBIGUOUS_ARGUMENT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_ambiguous_argument)

A function argument is being used in a way that suggests that the function signature may be misunderstood. This is thrown by the `assert` module when the `message` parameter in `assert.throws(block, message)` matches the error message thrown by `block` because that usage suggests that the user believes `message` is the expected message rather than the message the `AssertionError` will display if `block` does not throw.

#### `ERR_ARG_NOT_ITERABLE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_arg_not_iterable)

An iterable argument (i.e. a value that works with `for...of` loops) was required, but not provided to a Node.js API.

#### `ERR_ASSERTION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_assertion)

A special type of error that can be triggered whenever Node.js detects an exceptional logic violation that should never occur. These are raised typically by the `assert` module.

#### `ERR_ASYNC_CALLBACK`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_async_callback)

An attempt was made to register something that is not a function as an `AsyncHooks` callback.

#### `ERR_ASYNC_TYPE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_async_type)

The type of an asynchronous resource was invalid. Users are also able to define their own types if using the public embedder API.

#### `ERR_BROTLI_COMPRESSION_FAILED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_brotli_compression_failed)

Data passed to a Brotli stream was not successfully compressed.

#### `ERR_BROTLI_INVALID_PARAM`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_brotli_invalid_param)

An invalid parameter key was passed during construction of a Brotli stream.

#### `ERR_BUFFER_CONTEXT_NOT_AVAILABLE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_buffer_context_not_available)

An attempt was made to create a Node.js `Buffer` instance from addon or embedder code, while in a JS engine Context that is not associated with a Node.js instance. The data passed to the `Buffer` method will have been released by the time the method returns.

When encountering this error, a possible alternative to creating a `Buffer` instance is to create a normal `Uint8Array`, which only differs in the prototype of the resulting object. `Uint8Array`s are generally accepted in all Node.js core APIs where `Buffer`s are; they are available in all Contexts.

#### `ERR_BUFFER_OUT_OF_BOUNDS`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_buffer_out_of_bounds)

An operation outside the bounds of a `Buffer` was attempted.

#### `ERR_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_buffer_too_large)

An attempt has been made to create a `Buffer` larger than the maximum allowed size.

#### `ERR_CANNOT_WATCH_SIGINT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_cannot_watch_sigint)

Node.js was unable to watch for the `SIGINT` signal.

#### `ERR_CHILD_CLOSED_BEFORE_REPLY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_child_closed_before_reply)

A child process was closed before the parent received a reply.

#### `ERR_CHILD_PROCESS_IPC_REQUIRED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_child_process_ipc_required)

Used when a child process is being forked without specifying an IPC channel.

#### `ERR_CHILD_PROCESS_STDIO_MAXBUFFER`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_child_process_stdio_maxbuffer)

Used when the main process is trying to read data from the child process's STDERR/STDOUT, and the data's length is longer than the `maxBuffer` option.

#### `ERR_CLOSED_MESSAGE_PORT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_closed_message_port)

There was an attempt to use a `MessagePort` instance in a closed state, usually after `.close()` has been called.

#### `ERR_CONSOLE_WRITABLE_STREAM`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_console_writable_stream)

`Console` was instantiated without `stdout` stream, or `Console` has a non-writable `stdout` or `stderr` stream.

#### `ERR_CONSTRUCT_CALL_INVALID`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_construct_call_invalid)

A class constructor was called that is not callable.

#### `ERR_CONSTRUCT_CALL_REQUIRED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_construct_call_required)

A constructor for a class was called without `new`.

#### `ERR_CONTEXT_NOT_INITIALIZED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_context_not_initialized)

The vm context passed into the API is not yet initialized. This could happen when an error occurs (and is caught) during the creation of the context, for example, when the allocation fails or the maximum call stack size is reached when the context is created.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_CUSTOM_ENGINE_NOT_SUPPORTED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_custom_engine_not_supported)

A client certificate engine was requested that is not supported by the version of OpenSSL being used.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_ECDH_INVALID_FORMAT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_ecdh_invalid_format)

An invalid value for the `format` argument was passed to the `crypto.ECDH()` class `getPublicKey()` method.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_ECDH_INVALID_PUBLIC_KEY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_ecdh_invalid_public_key)

An invalid value for the `key` argument has been passed to the `crypto.ECDH()` class `computeSecret()` method. It means that the public key lies outside of the elliptic curve.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_ENGINE_UNKNOWN`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_engine_unknown)

An invalid crypto engine identifier was passed to [`require('crypto').setEngine()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_cryptosetengineengine-flags).

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_FIPS_FORCED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_fips_forced)

The [`--force-fips`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#cli_--force-fips) command-line argument was used but there was an attempt to enable or disable FIPS mode in the `crypto` module.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_FIPS_UNAVAILABLE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_fips_unavailable)

An attempt was made to enable or disable FIPS mode, but FIPS mode was not available.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_HASH_FINALIZED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_hash_finalized)

[`hash.digest()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_hashdigestencoding) was called multiple times. The `hash.digest()` method must be called no more than one time per instance of a `Hash` object.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_HASH_UPDATE_FAILED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_hash_update_failed)

[`hash.update()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_hashupdatedata-inputencoding) failed for any reason. This should rarely, if ever, happen.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INCOMPATIBLE_KEY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_incompatible_key)

The given crypto keys are incompatible with the attempted operation.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INCOMPATIBLE_KEY_OPTIONS`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_incompatible_key_options)

The selected public or private key encoding is incompatible with other options.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INITIALIZATION_FAILED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_initialization_failed)

Added in: v15.0.0

Initialization of the crypto subsystem failed.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_AUTH_TAG`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_auth_tag)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid authentication tag was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_COUNTER`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_counter)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid counter was provided for a counter-mode cipher.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_CURVE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_curve)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid elliptic-curve was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_DIGEST`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_digest)

An invalid [crypto digest algorithm](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_cryptogethashes) was specified.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_IV`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_iv)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid initialization vector was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_JWK`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_jwk)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid JSON Web Key was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_KEY_OBJECT_TYPE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_key_object_type)

The given crypto key object's type is invalid for the attempted operation.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_KEYLEN`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_keylen)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid key length was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_KEYPAIR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_keypair)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid key pair was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_KEYTYPE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_keytype)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid key type was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_MESSAGELEN`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_messagelen)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid message length was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_SCRYPT_PARAMS`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_scrypt_params)

Added in: v15.0.0

Invalid scrypt algorithm parameters were provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_STATE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_state)

A crypto method was used on an object that was in an invalid state. For instance, calling [`cipher.getAuthTag()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_ciphergetauthtag) before calling `cipher.final()`.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_INVALID_TAG_LENGTH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_invalid_tag_length)

Added in: v15.0.0

An invalid authentication tag length was provided.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_JOB_INIT_FAILED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_job_init_failed)

Added in: v15.0.0

Initialization of an asynchronous crypto operation failed.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_JWK_UNSUPPORTED_CURVE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_jwk_unsupported_curve)

Key's Elliptic Curve is not registered for use in the [JSON Web Key Elliptic Curve Registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/jose/jose.xhtml#web-key-elliptic-curve).

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_JWK_UNSUPPORTED_KEY_TYPE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_jwk_unsupported_key_type)

Key's Asymmetric Key Type is not registered for use in the [JSON Web Key Types Registry](https://www.iana.org/assignments/jose/jose.xhtml#web-key-types).

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_OPERATION_FAILED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_operation_failed)

Added in: v15.0.0

A crypto operation failed for an otherwise unspecified reason.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_PBKDF2_ERROR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_pbkdf2_error)

The PBKDF2 algorithm failed for unspecified reasons. OpenSSL does not provide more details and therefore neither does Node.js.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_SCRYPT_INVALID_PARAMETER`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_scrypt_invalid_parameter)

One or more [`crypto.scrypt()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_cryptoscryptpassword-salt-keylen-options-callback) or [`crypto.scryptSync()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_cryptoscryptsyncpassword-salt-keylen-options) parameters are outside their legal range.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_SCRYPT_NOT_SUPPORTED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_scrypt_not_supported)

Node.js was compiled without `scrypt` support. Not possible with the official release binaries but can happen with custom builds, including distro builds.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_SIGN_KEY_REQUIRED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_sign_key_required)

A signing `key` was not provided to the [`sign.sign()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_signsignprivatekey-outputencoding) method.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_TIMING_SAFE_EQUAL_LENGTH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_timing_safe_equal_length)

[`crypto.timingSafeEqual()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_cryptotimingsafeequala-b) was called with `Buffer`, `TypedArray`, or `DataView` arguments of different lengths.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_UNKNOWN_CIPHER`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_unknown_cipher)

An unknown cipher was specified.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_UNKNOWN_DH_GROUP`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_unknown_dh_group)

An unknown Diffie-Hellman group name was given. See [`crypto.getDiffieHellman()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#crypto_cryptogetdiffiehellmangroupname) for a list of valid group names.

#### `ERR_CRYPTO_UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_crypto_unsupported_operation)

Added in: v15.0.0

An attempt to invoke an unsupported crypto operation was made.

#### `ERR_DEBUGGER_ERROR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_debugger_error)

Added in: v16.4.0

An error occurred with the [debugger](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/debugger.html).

#### `ERR_DEBUGGER_STARTUP_ERROR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_debugger_startup_error)

Added in: v16.4.0

The [debugger](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/debugger.html) timed out waiting for the required host/port to be free.

#### `ERR_DLOPEN_DISABLED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_dlopen_disabled)

Added in: v16.10.0

Loading native addons has been disabled using [`--no-addons`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#cli_--no-addons).

#### `ERR_DLOPEN_FAILED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_dlopen_failed)

Added in: v15.0.0

A call to `process.dlopen()` failed.

#### `ERR_DIR_CLOSED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_dir_closed)

The [`fs.Dir`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_class-fsdir) was previously closed.

#### `ERR_DIR_CONCURRENT_OPERATION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_dir_concurrent_operation)

Added in: v14.3.0

A synchronous read or close call was attempted on an [`fs.Dir`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_class-fsdir) which has ongoing asynchronous operations.

#### `ERR_DNS_SET_SERVERS_FAILED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_dns_set_servers_failed)

`c-ares` failed to set the DNS server.

#### `ERR_DOMAIN_CALLBACK_NOT_AVAILABLE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_domain_callback_not_available)

The `domain` module was not usable since it could not establish the required error handling hooks, because [`process.setUncaughtExceptionCaptureCallback()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#process_processsetuncaughtexceptioncapturecallbackfn) had been called at an earlier point in time.

#### `ERR_DOMAIN_CANNOT_SET_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTION_CAPTURE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_domain_cannot_set_uncaught_exception_capture)

[`process.setUncaughtExceptionCaptureCallback()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#process_processsetuncaughtexceptioncapturecallbackfn) could not be called because the `domain` module has been loaded at an earlier point in time.

The stack trace is extended to include the point in time at which the `domain` module had been loaded.

#### `ERR_ENCODING_INVALID_ENCODED_DATA`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_encoding_invalid_encoded_data)

Data provided to `TextDecoder()` API was invalid according to the encoding provided.

#### `ERR_ENCODING_NOT_SUPPORTED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_encoding_not_supported)

Encoding provided to `TextDecoder()` API was not one of the [WHATWG Supported Encodings](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#util_whatwg-supported-encodings).

#### `ERR_EVAL_ESM_CANNOT_PRINT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_eval_esm_cannot_print)

`--print` cannot be used with ESM input.

#### `ERR_EVENT_RECURSION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_event_recursion)

Thrown when an attempt is made to recursively dispatch an event on `EventTarget`.

#### `ERR_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT_NOT_AVAILABLE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_execution_environment_not_available)

The JS execution context is not associated with a Node.js environment. This may occur when Node.js is used as an embedded library and some hooks for the JS engine are not set up properly.

#### `ERR_FALSY_VALUE_REJECTION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_falsy_value_rejection)

A `Promise` that was callbackified via `util.callbackify()` was rejected with a falsy value.

#### `ERR_FEATURE_UNAVAILABLE_ON_PLATFORM`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_feature_unavailable_on_platform)

Added in: v14.0.0

Used when a feature that is not available to the current platform which is running Node.js is used.

#### `ERR_FS_CP_DIR_TO_NON_DIR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_dir_to_non_dir)

An attempt was made to copy a directory to a non-directory (file, symlink, etc.) using [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback).

#### `ERR_FS_CP_EEXIST`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_eexist)

An attempt was made to copy over a file that already existed with [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback), with the `force` and `errorOnExist` set to `true`.

#### `ERR_FS_CP_EINVAL`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_einval)

When using [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback), `src` or `dest` pointed to an invalid path.

#### `ERR_FS_CP_FIFO_PIPE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_fifo_pipe)

An attempt was made to copy a named pipe with [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback).

#### `ERR_FS_CP_NON_DIR_TO_DIR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_non_dir_to_dir)

An attempt was made to copy a non-directory (file, symlink, etc.) to a directory using [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback).

#### `ERR_FS_CP_SOCKET`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_socket)

An attempt was made to copy to a socket with [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback).

#### `ERR_FS_CP_SYMLINK_TO_SUBDIRECTORY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_symlink_to_subdirectory)

When using [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback), a symlink in `dest` pointed to a subdirectory of `src`.

#### `ERR_FS_CP_UNKNOWN`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_cp_unknown)

An attempt was made to copy to an unknown file type with [`fs.cp()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fscpsrc-dest-options-callback).

#### `ERR_FS_EISDIR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_eisdir)

Path is a directory.

#### `ERR_FS_FILE_TOO_LARGE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_file_too_large)

An attempt has been made to read a file whose size is larger than the maximum allowed size for a `Buffer`.

#### `ERR_FS_INVALID_SYMLINK_TYPE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_fs_invalid_symlink_type)

An invalid symlink type was passed to the [`fs.symlink()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fssymlinktarget-path-type-callback) or [`fs.symlinkSync()`](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#fs_fssymlinksynctarget-path-type) methods.

#### `ERR_HTTP_HEADERS_SENT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http_headers_sent)

An attempt was made to add more headers after the headers had already been sent.

#### `ERR_HTTP_INVALID_HEADER_VALUE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http_invalid_header_value)

An invalid HTTP header value was specified.

#### `ERR_HTTP_INVALID_STATUS_CODE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http_invalid_status_code)

Status code was outside the regular status code range (100-999).

#### `ERR_HTTP_REQUEST_TIMEOUT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http_request_timeout)

The client has not sent the entire request within the allowed time.

#### `ERR_HTTP_SOCKET_ENCODING`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http_socket_encoding)

Changing the socket encoding is not allowed per [RFC 7230 Section 3](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230#section-3).

#### `ERR_HTTP_TRAILER_INVALID`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http_trailer_invalid)

The `Trailer` header was set even though the transfer encoding does not support that.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_ALTSVC_INVALID_ORIGIN`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_altsvc_invalid_origin)

HTTP/2 ALTSVC frames require a valid origin.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_ALTSVC_LENGTH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_altsvc_length)

HTTP/2 ALTSVC frames are limited to a maximum of 16,382 payload bytes.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_CONNECT_AUTHORITY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_connect_authority)

For HTTP/2 requests using the `CONNECT` method, the `:authority` pseudo-header is required.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_CONNECT_PATH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_connect_path)

For HTTP/2 requests using the `CONNECT` method, the `:path` pseudo-header is forbidden.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_CONNECT_SCHEME`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_connect_scheme)

For HTTP/2 requests using the `CONNECT` method, the `:scheme` pseudo-header is forbidden.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_ERROR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_error)

A non-specific HTTP/2 error has occurred.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_GOAWAY_SESSION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_goaway_session)

New HTTP/2 Streams may not be opened after the `Http2Session` has received a `GOAWAY` frame from the connected peer.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_HEADER_SINGLE_VALUE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_header_single_value)

Multiple values were provided for an HTTP/2 header field that was required to have only a single value.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_HEADERS_AFTER_RESPOND`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_headers_after_respond)

An additional headers was specified after an HTTP/2 response was initiated.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_HEADERS_SENT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_headers_sent)

An attempt was made to send multiple response headers.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INFO_STATUS_NOT_ALLOWED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_info_status_not_allowed)

Informational HTTP status codes (`1xx`) may not be set as the response status code on HTTP/2 responses.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_CONNECTION_HEADERS`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_connection_headers)

HTTP/1 connection specific headers are forbidden to be used in HTTP/2 requests and responses.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_HEADER_VALUE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_header_value)

An invalid HTTP/2 header value was specified.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_INFO_STATUS`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_info_status)

An invalid HTTP informational status code has been specified. Informational status codes must be an integer between `100` and `199` (inclusive).

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_ORIGIN`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_origin)

HTTP/2 `ORIGIN` frames require a valid origin.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_PACKED_SETTINGS_LENGTH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_packed_settings_length)

Input `Buffer` and `Uint8Array` instances passed to the `http2.getUnpackedSettings()` API must have a length that is a multiple of six.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_PSEUDOHEADER`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_pseudoheader)

Only valid HTTP/2 pseudoheaders (`:status`, `:path`, `:authority`, `:scheme`, and `:method`) may be used.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_SESSION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_session)

An action was performed on an `Http2Session` object that had already been destroyed.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_SETTING_VALUE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_setting_value)

An invalid value has been specified for an HTTP/2 setting.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_INVALID_STREAM`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_invalid_stream)

An operation was performed on a stream that had already been destroyed.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_MAX_PENDING_SETTINGS_ACK`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_max_pending_settings_ack)

Whenever an HTTP/2 `SETTINGS` frame is sent to a connected peer, the peer is required to send an acknowledgment that it has received and applied the new `SETTINGS`. By default, a maximum number of unacknowledged `SETTINGS` frames may be sent at any given time. This error code is used when that limit has been reached.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_NESTED_PUSH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_nested_push)

An attempt was made to initiate a new push stream from within a push stream. Nested push streams are not permitted.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_NO_MEM`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_no_mem)

Out of memory when using the `http2session.setLocalWindowSize(windowSize)` API.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_NO_SOCKET_MANIPULATION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_no_socket_manipulation)

An attempt was made to directly manipulate (read, write, pause, resume, etc.) a socket attached to an `Http2Session`.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_ORIGIN_LENGTH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_origin_length)

HTTP/2 `ORIGIN` frames are limited to a length of 16382 bytes.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_OUT_OF_STREAMS`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_out_of_streams)

The number of streams created on a single HTTP/2 session reached the maximum limit.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_PAYLOAD_FORBIDDEN`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_payload_forbidden)

A message payload was specified for an HTTP response code for which a payload is forbidden.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_PING_CANCEL`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_ping_cancel)

An HTTP/2 ping was canceled.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_PING_LENGTH`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_ping_length)

HTTP/2 ping payloads must be exactly 8 bytes in length.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_PSEUDOHEADER_NOT_ALLOWED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_pseudoheader_not_allowed)

An HTTP/2 pseudo-header has been used inappropriately. Pseudo-headers are header key names that begin with the `:` prefix.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_PUSH_DISABLED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_push_disabled)

An attempt was made to create a push stream, which had been disabled by the client.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_SEND_FILE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_send_file)

An attempt was made to use the `Http2Stream.prototype.responseWithFile()` API to send a directory.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_SEND_FILE_NOSEEK`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_send_file_noseek)

An attempt was made to use the `Http2Stream.prototype.responseWithFile()` API to send something other than a regular file, but `offset` or `length` options were provided.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_SESSION_ERROR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_session_error)

The `Http2Session` closed with a non-zero error code.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_SETTINGS_CANCEL`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_settings_cancel)

The `Http2Session` settings canceled.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_SOCKET_BOUND`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_socket_bound)

An attempt was made to connect a `Http2Session` object to a `net.Socket` or `tls.TLSSocket` that had already been bound to another `Http2Session` object.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_SOCKET_UNBOUND`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_socket_unbound)

An attempt was made to use the `socket` property of an `Http2Session` that has already been closed.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_STATUS_101`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_status_101)

Use of the `101` Informational status code is forbidden in HTTP/2.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_STATUS_INVALID`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_status_invalid)

An invalid HTTP status code has been specified. Status codes must be an integer between `100` and `599` (inclusive).

#### `ERR_HTTP2_STREAM_CANCEL`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_stream_cancel)

An `Http2Stream` was destroyed before any data was transmitted to the connected peer.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_STREAM_ERROR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_stream_error)

A non-zero error code was been specified in an `RST_STREAM` frame.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_STREAM_SELF_DEPENDENCY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_stream_self_dependency)

When setting the priority for an HTTP/2 stream, the stream may be marked as a dependency for a parent stream. This error code is used when an attempt is made to mark a stream and dependent of itself.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_TOO_MANY_INVALID_FRAMES`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_too_many_invalid_frames)

The limit of acceptable invalid HTTP/2 protocol frames sent by the peer, as specified through the `maxSessionInvalidFrames` option, has been exceeded.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_TRAILERS_ALREADY_SENT`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_trailers_already_sent)

Trailing headers have already been sent on the `Http2Stream`.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_TRAILERS_NOT_READY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_trailers_not_ready)

The `http2stream.sendTrailers()` method cannot be called until after the `'wantTrailers'` event is emitted on an `Http2Stream` object. The `'wantTrailers'` event will only be emitted if the `waitForTrailers` option is set for the `Http2Stream`.

#### `ERR_HTTP2_UNSUPPORTED_PROTOCOL`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_http2_unsupported_protocol)

`http2.connect()` was passed a URL that uses any protocol other than `http:` or `https:`.

#### `ERR_ILLEGAL_CONSTRUCTOR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_illegal_constructor)

An attempt was made to construct an object using a non-public constructor.

#### `ERR_INCOMPATIBLE_OPTION_PAIR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_incompatible_option_pair)

An option pair is incompatible with each other and cannot be used at the same time.

#### `ERR_INPUT_TYPE_NOT_ALLOWED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_input_type_not_allowed)

The `--input-type` flag was used to attempt to execute a file. This flag can only be used with input via `--eval`, `--print` or `STDIN`.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_ALREADY_ACTIVATED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_already_activated)

While using the `inspector` module, an attempt was made to activate the inspector when it already started to listen on a port. Use `inspector.close()` before activating it on a different address.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_ALREADY_CONNECTED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_already_connected)

While using the `inspector` module, an attempt was made to connect when the inspector was already connected.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_CLOSED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_closed)

While using the `inspector` module, an attempt was made to use the inspector after the session had already closed.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_COMMAND`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_command)

An error occurred while issuing a command via the `inspector` module.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_NOT_ACTIVE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_not_active)

The `inspector` is not active when `inspector.waitForDebugger()` is called.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_NOT_AVAILABLE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_not_available)

The `inspector` module is not available for use.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_NOT_CONNECTED`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_not_connected)

While using the `inspector` module, an attempt was made to use the inspector before it was connected.

#### `ERR_INSPECTOR_NOT_WORKER`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_inspector_not_worker)

An API was called on the main thread that can only be used from the worker thread.

#### `ERR_INTERNAL_ASSERTION`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_internal_assertion)

There was a bug in Node.js or incorrect usage of Node.js internals. To fix the error, open an issue at [https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues).

#### `ERR_INVALID_ADDRESS_FAMILY`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_invalid_address_family)

The provided address family is not understood by the Node.js API.

#### `ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_invalid_arg_type)

An argument of the wrong type was passed to a Node.js API.

#### `ERR_INVALID_ARG_VALUE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_invalid_arg_value)

An invalid or unsupported value was passed for a given argument.

#### `ERR_INVALID_ASYNC_ID`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_invalid_async_id)

An invalid `asyncId` or `triggerAsyncId` was passed using `AsyncHooks`. An id less than -1 should never happen.

#### `ERR_INVALID_BUFFER_SIZE`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_invalid_buffer_size)

A swap was performed on a `Buffer` but its size was not compatible with the operation.

#### `ERR_INVALID_CALLBACK`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_invalid_callback)

A callback function was required but was not been provided to a Node.js API.

#### `ERR_INVALID_CHAR`[#](https://nodejs.org/dist/v16.13.1/docs/api/all.html#errors_err_invalid_char)
